metrics.what_is_measured: How steady your head is while you speak. This captures natural nodding and tilting that signal engagement, versus being frozen or excessively bobbing.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We track how much your head position changes between video frames, normalized to your face size and converted to movement per second.
metrics.why_it_matters: Natural head movement shows you're an active listener and engaged speaker. Too little looks stiff and unapproachable; too much looks distracting and undermines authority.

score_semantics.0: Head movement is far from the ideal range (either frozen stiff or excessively bobbing).
score_semantics.1: Natural, engaged head movement within the optimal range.

interpretation_buckets.label: rigid
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Stiff neck. Frozen.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Nod slightly to show agreement or emphasis. You look stiff.

interpretation_buckets.label: stable
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Very controlled. Serious but attentive.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Good control. A bit more movement could make you look warmer.

interpretation_buckets.label: optimal
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Natural head engagement (Excellent). Good nodding and tilting.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Perfect head engagement. Your nods make you look like an active listener.

interpretation_buckets.label: high
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Active head movement. Engaged but energetic.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: High energy. Ensure your head movements are intentional, not random.

interpretation_buckets.label: distracting
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Excessive head movement (Poor). Bobblehead effect.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Keep your head steady. Excessive nodding undermines your authority.

metrics.what_is_measured: How stable and focused your eye contact is. This captures whether you maintain a confident, locked-in gaze versus darting or scanning nervously.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We measure how much your gaze direction changes each second by tracking your iris positions relative to your face.
metrics.why_it_matters: Steady eye contact makes you appear confident and connected. Frequent gaze shifts can make you seem nervous, disengaged, or untrustworthy.
metrics.raw_value_unit: variance of gaze change per second

score_semantics.0: Highly unstable gaze with frequent darting or scanning.
score_semantics.1: Steady, confident gaze with minimal jitter.

interpretation_buckets.label: optimal
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Highly controlled gaze (Excellent). Locked-in, confident gaze.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Excellent focus. You connect strongly with the viewer.

interpretation_buckets.label: good
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Natural gaze behavior (Good). Natural eye contact.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Good eye contact. You feel present.

interpretation_buckets.label: weak
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Slightly unstable gaze (Weak). Occasional scanning.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Hold your gaze for longer. Stop scanning the room.

interpretation_buckets.label: poor
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Unsteady or nervous gaze (Poor). Frequent darting.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Look at the camera lens, not your screen. You seem disengaged.

metrics.notes: The baseline 'MIDPOINT' (0.10) is the logistic inflection point, not the optimal value. Optimal gaze jitter is ≤0.08.

metrics.what_is_measured: How much you smile during your presentation. This captures warmth and approachability through facial expression.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We measure the width of your mouth (distance between lip corners) relative to the distance between your eyes.
metrics.why_it_matters: A natural smile makes you appear warm, approachable, and confident. Too little can seem cold or severe; too much may appear forced or insincere.

score_semantics.0: Smile is far from the natural optimal range (either absent or excessive).
score_semantics.1: Natural, balanced smile within the optimal range.

interpretation_buckets.label: flat
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Flat or absent smile (Poor). Serious, poker face.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Smile with your eyes. You look a bit severe.

interpretation_buckets.label: neutral
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Low smile activation (Weak). Professional but reserved.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Try to smile at the start and end of your sentences.

interpretation_buckets.label: optimal
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Balanced, natural smile (Excellent). Warm and approachable.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Perfect smile intensity. You look friendly and engaged.

interpretation_buckets.label: expressive
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Very high smile (Good). Highly radiant, possibly over-expressive.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Great energy! Just ensure your smile feels natural for the context.

metrics.what_is_measured: How much time your head is tilted downward during your presentation. This captures whether you maintain forward-facing posture or spend time looking at notes, the floor, or avoiding the audience.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We use 3D head pose estimation (solvePnP) to calculate your head pitch angle. When your head pitch exceeds 20°, you are considered to be looking down. The ratio is the percentage of time spent in this position.
metrics.why_it_matters: Looking down too much signals nervousness, lack of preparation, or avoidance. Maintaining forward posture builds connection and projects confidence.

score_semantics.0: Spends most of the time with head tilted down (reading notes, avoiding audience).
score_semantics.1: Maintains excellent forward posture, rarely looking down.

interpretation_buckets.label: forward
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Excellent posture. Head facing audience.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Great presence! You maintain strong forward posture.

interpretation_buckets.label: occasional_down
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Good posture with occasional glances down.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Good balance. Try to look up more between points.

interpretation_buckets.label: frequent_down
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Head often tilted down.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Practice your content so you can look up more.

interpretation_buckets.label: mostly_down
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Head mostly facing down. Avoids audience.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Look at your audience. You're reading too much.

metrics.notes: Uses 3D head pose estimation (solvePnP with 6 landmarks) to compute pitch angle in degrees. The ratio represents % of time with pitch > 14°. Robust to head rotation and camera angle.

metrics.what_is_measured: Your overall facial expressiveness and presence during the presentation, combining head movement, eye contact, smile, and head posture.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We average the scores from head stability, gaze consistency, smile activation, and head down ratio.
metrics.why_it_matters: Your face is the primary channel for conveying warmth, confidence, and engagement. A strong facial communication score means you connect well visually.

score_semantics.0: Facial signals may be distracting or weak.
score_semantics.1: Excellent facial communication with high presence, warmth, and control.

interpretation_buckets.label: needs_improvement
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Needs improvement. Facial signals may be distracting or weak.

interpretation_buckets.label: good
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Good facial communication. Balanced and effective.

interpretation_buckets.label: excellent
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Excellent facial communication. High presence, warmth, and control.

global_aggregation.formula: Average of head stability, gaze stability, smile activation, and head down ratio communication scores.

metrics.notes: Global interpretation uses the score (0-1), not raw values. Buckets are score-based.

metrics.what_is_measured: How large and expansive your hand gestures are. This captures whether you use confident, space-claiming gestures or keep your hands close to your body.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We measure how far your wrists are from your torso center, normalized to your shoulder width.
metrics.why_it_matters: Larger gestures project confidence and help emphasize key points. Gestures that are too small look timid; gestures that are too large can be distracting.

score_semantics.0: Gestures are far from the ideal size (either too small or excessively large).
score_semantics.1: Gestures are confident and well-sized within the optimal range.

interpretation_buckets.label: very_low
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Gestures too small (Weak). Hands glued to sides/lap.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Unlock your hands. Try to make at least one large gesture per sentence.

interpretation_buckets.label: low
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Small, timid gestures.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Open up your posture. Imagine holding a beach ball, not a tennis ball.

interpretation_buckets.label: optimal
interpretation_buckets.user_text: High gesture dynamics (Excellent). Confident, expansive gestures.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Excellent use of space. Your gestures command attention.

interpretation_buckets.label: high
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Very large, theatrical gestures.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Great energy, but ensure your gestures don't block your face.

interpretation_buckets.label: very_high
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Wild, flailing movements. Distracting.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Keep your gestures within the 'box' (shoulders to hips). You are flailing.

metrics.what_is_measured: How dynamic and fluid your hand movements are. This captures the speed and energy of your gestures throughout the presentation.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We track how fast your wrists move over time, normalized to your shoulder width and converted to movement per second.
metrics.why_it_matters: Dynamic gestures keep the audience engaged and help emphasize your words. Too little movement looks static and boring; too much looks frantic.

score_semantics.0: Gesture pace is far from ideal (either statue-like or frantic).
score_semantics.1: Dynamic, fluid gesture pace within the optimal range.

interpretation_buckets.label: very_low
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Statue-like. No movement.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Move your hands to emphasize key verbs. You look frozen.

interpretation_buckets.label: low
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Too static (Weak). Slow, lethargic movement.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Add some snap to your gestures. Match the rhythm of your speech.

interpretation_buckets.label: optimal
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Optimal gesture pace (Excellent). Dynamic, fluid movement.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Perfect gesture pacing. Your hands move naturally with your words.

interpretation_buckets.label: high
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Fast, energetic movement.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: High energy! Just be careful not to look frantic.

interpretation_buckets.label: very_high
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Chaotic, frantic waving.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Slow down. Your hands are moving faster than your audience can follow.

metrics.what_is_measured: How smooth and intentional your gestures are. This captures whether your hand movements are controlled and deliberate versus shaky or fidgety.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We measure the variance in your gesture speed each second — lower variance means smoother, more intentional movements.
metrics.why_it_matters: Smooth gestures project composure and confidence. Shaky or fidgety hands can signal nervousness and distract your audience.
metrics.raw_value_unit: variance of gesture activity per second

score_semantics.0: Gestures are shaky, fidgety, and unstable.
score_semantics.1: Gestures are smooth, intentional, and composed.

interpretation_buckets.label: optimal
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Extremely stable gestures (Excellent). Smooth, intentional movement.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Excellent stability. You look very composed.

interpretation_buckets.label: good
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Natural stability (Good). Healthy fluidity.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Good control. Your hands look steady.

interpretation_buckets.label: high
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Mild instability (Weak). Occasional shaking.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Smooth out your movements. Try to be more deliberate.

interpretation_buckets.label: very_high
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Strong jitter / instability (Poor). Fidgety hands.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Plant your hands when not gesturing. Avoid nervous ticks.

metrics.notes: Measures variance of gesture activity per second. Lower variance = more stable, intentional gestures.

metrics.what_is_measured: How much your torso moves side-to-side or back-and-forth. This captures whether you have a grounded, stable presence versus restless rocking.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We track how much your torso center moves over time, normalized to your shoulder width and converted to movement per second.
metrics.why_it_matters: A grounded stance projects confidence and authority. Too much sway can be distracting and make you appear nervous or unsteady.

score_semantics.0: Body movement is far from ideal (either robotically still or excessively swaying).
score_semantics.1: Natural, grounded posture with controlled movement.

interpretation_buckets.label: rigid
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Robotically still. Unnatural.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Relax your shoulders. It's okay to shift your weight slightly.

interpretation_buckets.label: stable
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Grounded, controlled posture (Excellent). Very grounded.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Great stability. You look very grounded.

interpretation_buckets.label: optimal
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Natural controlled movement (Good). Natural, relaxed posture.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Natural posture. You look comfortable and engaged.

interpretation_buckets.label: unstable
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Restless torso movement (Weak). Noticeable swaying.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Plant your feet. You are starting to rock back and forth.

interpretation_buckets.label: distracting
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Strong body sway (Poor). Sea-sickness inducing sway.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Stop moving your torso. Imagine a string pulling you up from the crown of your head.

metrics.what_is_measured: How open and confident your posture is. This captures whether your arms are open and natural versus closed and defensive.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We use a 2-component composite: (1) arm closeness (from gesture magnitude) and (2) wrist position relative to torso (depth). A defensive posture penalty is applied when arms are close to the body AND wrists are in front of the torso, indicating crossed arms or a barrier posture.
metrics.why_it_matters: Open posture signals confidence and approachability. Closed, hunched posture can make you appear defensive or insecure.

score_semantics.0.2: Closed, defensive posture (arms close + wrists forward).
score_semantics.0.6: Neutral posture (arms at rest, hands at sides or behind).

interpretation_buckets.label: closed
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Closed, defensive posture (Poor). Arms close to body with hands forward.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Open up your arms. You look guarded and defensive.

interpretation_buckets.label: neutral
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Neutral posture (Ok). Arms at rest, hands at sides or behind.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Try using more hand gestures to engage your audience.

interpretation_buckets.label: open
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Open, expressive posture (Excellent). Good use of gestures.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Great body language! You look confident and approachable.

metrics.notes: Refactored from shoulder angle to arms-based scoring (gesture_magnitude + wrist_depth).

metrics.what_is_measured: Your overall physical presence and expressiveness, combining gesture size, gesture activity, gesture stability, body sway, and posture.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We average the scores from all five body metrics.
metrics.why_it_matters: Your body language reinforces your message and projects confidence. A strong body language score means you use physical presence effectively.

score_semantics.0: Body signals may be distracting, weak, or closed-off.
score_semantics.1: Excellent body language with high presence, energy, and control.

interpretation_buckets.label: needs_improvement
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Needs improvement. Body signals may be distracting, weak, or closed-off.

interpretation_buckets.label: good
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Good body language. Balanced and effective.

interpretation_buckets.label: excellent
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Excellent body language. High presence, energy, and control.

global_aggregation.formula: Average of gesture magnitude, gesture activity, gesture stability, body sway, and posture openness communication scores.

metrics.notes: Global interpretation uses the score (0-1), not raw values. Buckets are score-based.

metrics.what_is_measured: How fast you speak, measured in words per minute. This captures your pacing and whether it's easy for the audience to follow.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We transcribe your speech and count the words, then divide by the speaking time.
metrics.why_it_matters: The right pace keeps your audience engaged and ensures comprehension. Too slow can bore; too fast can overwhelm and cause people to miss key points.

score_semantics.0: Speaking pace is far from ideal (either very slow or overwhelming).
score_semantics.1: Speaking pace is within the optimal range for clarity and engagement.

interpretation_buckets.label: very_slow
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Very slow pace; can feel heavy or overly deliberate.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Increase your tempo on less critical details to add energy.

interpretation_buckets.label: slow
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Slower than typical; very clear but may lack energy.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Speed up slightly to keep the flow engaging, while keeping clarity.

interpretation_buckets.label: optimal
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Optimal pace. Easy to follow and engaging.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Excellent pace! You are easy to follow and engaging.

interpretation_buckets.label: fast
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Energetic and lively. Good for excitement.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Great energy. Just ensure you pause enough to let points land.

interpretation_buckets.label: rushed
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Very fast; listeners might miss details.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Slow down slightly. You risk losing the audience's comprehension.

interpretation_buckets.label: overwhelming
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Too rapid; cognitive overload for listeners.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Deliberately slow down. Force yourself to take a breath between sentences.

metrics.what_is_measured: How much silence you use relative to speaking time. This captures your rhythm and use of pauses for emphasis.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We detect speech versus silence and calculate the percentage of time that is silent.
metrics.why_it_matters: Strategic pauses add emphasis and give the audience time to absorb your points. Too few pauses sound rushed; too many sound hesitant.

score_semantics.0: Pause usage is far from ideal (either no pauses or excessive silence).
score_semantics.1: Perfect rhythm with strategic use of silence for emphasis.

interpretation_buckets.label: no_pauses
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Machine-gun delivery. No breathing room.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Force yourself to pause for 1 second after every key point.

interpretation_buckets.label: low_pauses
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Fast-flowing speech. Good energy but dense.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Add micro-pauses to let key points land.

interpretation_buckets.label: optimal
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Perfect rhythm. Natural flow with good pacing.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Great pacing! You sound confident and natural.

interpretation_buckets.label: frequent_pauses
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Deliberate style. Clear but may lose momentum.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Good clarity, but keep the energy up between pauses.

interpretation_buckets.label: disjointed
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Too many pauses. Breaks the flow.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Connect your ideas more smoothly. Reduce pause length.

interpretation_buckets.label: fragmented
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Excessive silence; sounds hesitant or unprepared.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Try to keep your train of thought moving. Avoid long gaps.

metrics.what_is_measured: How much your pitch varies (intonation). This captures whether you speak in a monotone voice or use expressive melody.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We measure the standard deviation of your pitch in semitones.
metrics.why_it_matters: Pitch variation conveys emotion and keeps the audience interested. A monotone voice is boring; too much variation can sound theatrical or insincere.

score_semantics.0: Pitch variation is far from ideal (either robotic or exaggerated).

interpretation_buckets.label: monotone
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Completely monotone. Hard to listen to.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: You need to vary your pitch. Try emphasizing one word in every sentence.

interpretation_buckets.label: neutral
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Reserved and controlled, but lacks emotion.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Try to 'color' your words more. Don't be afraid to go higher or lower.

interpretation_buckets.label: expressive
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Good expressiveness. Engaging vocal melody.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Good intonation! Your voice carries emotion well.

interpretation_buckets.label: exaggerated
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Rollercoaster pitch; can be distracting.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Tone it down slightly. Too much variation can sound insincere.

metrics.what_is_measured: How much your volume changes (dynamic range). This captures whether you use volume for emphasis or speak at a flat level.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We measure the coefficient of variation of your volume (RMS amplitude).
metrics.why_it_matters: Volume dynamics add emotional texture. A flat volume is boring; extreme swings can be jarring.

score_semantics.0: Volume dynamics are far from ideal (either flat or unstable).

interpretation_buckets.label: flat
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Flat volume. No emotional emphasis.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Punch your key words! Make important ideas louder than the rest.

interpretation_buckets.label: low
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Controlled volume. Polite but could be more dynamic.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Don't be afraid to whisper or project. Use volume to tell the story.

interpretation_buckets.label: optimal
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Dynamic delivery. Good emotional texture.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Great dynamic range. You use volume effectively to convey emotion.

interpretation_buckets.label: expressive
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Highly dynamic. Strong emotional variation.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Very expressive! Just ensure consistency in calmer moments.

interpretation_buckets.label: unstable
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Extreme volume swings. Can be jarring.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Be careful of sudden shouts or drops. Keep the baseline steady.

metrics.what_is_measured: How much energy and attack your voice has. This captures the clarity and power of your articulation.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We measure the ratio between your voice peaks and overall loudness, expressed in decibels (crest factor).
metrics.why_it_matters: Vocal punch makes your voice cut through clearly and sound authoritative. Too little sounds muffled; too much sounds aggressive.

score_semantics.0: Vocal energy is far from ideal (either muffled/flat or aggressive/shouting).
score_semantics.1: Strong vocal energy with clear, punchy articulation.

interpretation_buckets.label: muffled
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Muffled/Flat (Weak). Lacks energy and attack.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Articulate more clearly. Hit your consonants harder.

interpretation_buckets.label: soft
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Gentle delivery. Good for intimacy, bad for power.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Project your voice more. Imagine reaching the back of the room.

interpretation_buckets.label: optimal
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Strong vocal energy. Clear, punchy articulation.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Strong vocal presence. Your voice cuts through clearly.

interpretation_buckets.label: strong
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Very punchy. High energy and presence.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Great presence! Just be mindful of the context.

interpretation_buckets.label: aggressive
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Aggressive (Distracting). Too punchy or shouting.
interpretation_buckets.coaching: Soften your attack slightly. You don't need to shout to be heard.

metrics.what_is_measured: Your overall vocal delivery, combining speech rate, pause usage, pitch variation, volume dynamics, and vocal energy.
metrics.how_it_is_measured: We average the scores from all five audio metrics.
metrics.why_it_matters: Your voice is how you convey emotion, emphasis, and authority. A strong vocal presence score means you sound engaging, clear, and dynamic.

score_semantics.0: Voice may be monotone, rushed, or flat.
score_semantics.1: Excellent vocal presence — engaging, clear, and dynamic.

interpretation_buckets.label: needs_improvement
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Needs improvement. Voice may be monotone, rushed, or flat.

interpretation_buckets.label: good
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Good vocal presence. Balanced and effective.

interpretation_buckets.label: excellent
interpretation_buckets.user_text: Excellent vocal presence. Engaging, clear, and dynamic.

global_aggregation.formula: Average of speech rate, pause ratio, pitch dynamic, volume dynamic, and vocal punch scores.

metrics.notes: Global interpretation uses the score (0-1), not raw values. Buckets are score-based. Audio module has no consistency scores.
